headline: Gas Prices Continue To Rise In Western Pennsylvania
sentences: "We're going into what should generally be the time of the year when gas prices go up, anyway, when more people hit the road," AAA East Central Director of Public Affairs Jim Garrity said.
"It really is a good time now to start making those changes, knowing that gasoline prices could continue to go up in the weeks ahead," Garrity said.
"It could be potentially record-setting prices in Pennsylvania, but that's something, of course, we have to wait and see," Garrity said.
At this point, AAA said it's too soon to know the impact of the Russia-Ukraine situation on the oil market.
PITTSBURGH (KDKA) -- Gas prices continue to climb, and there may be no end in sight.
"You are burning more gasoline and burning it way less efficiently," Garrity said.
According to AAA, the average price of gas in Pennsylvania is $3.73 a gallon.
If this stays the case, the national average could approach $4 a gallon.
In the last week, AAA said gas prices in our area went up about 6 cents.
He said prices have gone up steadily for the last 13 to 14 months.
It's 50 to 60 cents of every dollar your spending," Garrity said.
Combine trips, drive less and use more fuel-efficient vehicles.
According to Garrity, crude oil is about $93 to $94 a barrel.
In early 2021, it was about $30 to $40 a barrel.
That is such a big part of what you're spending.
He also recommends trying not to speed.
So what can you do to save money?
